page.title: 04SCENERY AROUND CURDWORTH
page.content: THE UNDULATING LANDSCAPE AROUND THE AREA CAN HAVE CHANGED LITTLE SINCE ENCLOSURE UNTIL NOW. HEDGES HAVE GONE GIVING A BARREN ASPECT TO THE OUTLYING FIELDS. THE RIVER TAME TO THE SOUTH HAS A SMALL AMOUNT OF WOODLAND ON ITS BANK. A NARROW SPINNEY ALONG THE CANAL TO THE NORTH. THE EAST IS DOMINATED BY THE COOLING TOWERS AND PYLONS OF THE POWER STATION AND NOW THE MOTORWAY. SEWAGE WORKS TO THE WEST. CURDWORTH VILLAGE LIES IN A HOLLOW, THE CHURCH ON RISING GROUND EASILY SEEN. BECAUSE OF THE ENVIRONMENT CURDWORTH AND WATER ORTON HAVE A LOT OF POLLUTION. THE RIVER TAME IS NOW IMPROVED AND THE FISH BACK. THE WASTE EMITTED FROM THE POWER STATION IS LESS NOW, AND THE WARM WATER FROM THE COOLING TOWERS HAS ATTRACTED MANY WATER BIRDS TO THE NATURE RESERVE. THERE ARE FOOTPATHS AND A VARIETY OF FLORA AND FAUNA.
